meanings.definition: The act of replacing or taking the place of something else.
meanings.sent1: The supersedure of the old manager by a new one caused excitement in the office.
meanings.sent2: The supersedure of traditional methods with modern technology has increased efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The supersedure of the old recipe with a new one led to a tastier dish.
meanings.sent4: Her promotion to CEO marked the supersedure of her previous role as a junior employee.
meanings.sent5: The supersedure of the outdated law brought about positive changes in society.

meanings.definition: The state of being replaced or succeeded by something else.
meanings.sent1: The supersedure of the old system by a more advanced one was inevitable.
meanings.sent2: The supersedure of the aging actor by a younger talent was well-received by the audience.
meanings.sent3: The supersedure of the worn-out shoes with new ones brought relief to his feet.
meanings.sent4: The supersedure of the old traditions with modern practices signaled progress in the community.
meanings.sent5: The supersedure of the outdated model with the latest version delighted customers.
